Agenda:  • 6:30 Food & Drinks• 7:00 Coding Dojo  (Please bring your own laptop with Clojure and editor installed) • 8:15 Neural Networks in Clojure: a tour with Cortex and Tensorflow - by Kiran Sponsors:  Thanks again to ThoughtWorks and Flybot for organizing and sponsoring this event.Please update your attendance if you can't make it, so folks on the wait list can fill your spot. 

Slack Channel  We have a #clojure-sg slack channel. To join, simply join the Clojurians team: http://clojurians.net/ and then search for the #clojure-sg channel, where you can post questions or share your clojure using experience.

events.name: Vue.js - A New Hope, 1st meetup combined with Full Stack Programmers
events.description:
1st Vue.js meetup event. This will be a combined event with Full Stack Programmers. A thank you to Aaron for the venue. 


 


What IS Vue.js? Vue.js is the next big thing in frontend development. Already, this week (yes 13 Jun 2017) it is the most starred frontend framework on Github almost 55K. Independent, super simple and with the Chinese big names behind like Alibaba and Tencent, Vue.js this is the next big thing, rapidly gaining on React and Angular. Join us for the first ever meet up for Vue.js in Singapore. Get to know people already using Vue.js in production. The Tide Is Turning! Red Line - Vue.jsBlue Line - React.js https://qph.ec.quoracdn.net/main-qimg-93544119ca671c69e6b0d4370adbbd19.webp 







Hybrid  Vue.js is now allowing web developers to make the transition to Single Page Applications. 



1) Vue.js 101 - Introduction- Lionel Yeo, Partner Wesvault & Vue.js Evangelist > What the is Vue.js? A brief history> Why Vue and What Makes It Different?> Why some say it's the next big thing?> Live Coding (only because Vue is just so simple!) 




2) Vue For Real- Tai Shi Ling, CEO & Co-founder of UI-licious Vue isn't just fiction anymore. Vue is now used in real production. Find out and ask how the process is and if this trend will continue. 


==================================                         Sponsorship's ================================== Hi everyone, we are opening our group to sponsorship. If you want to reach out to developers, tech entrepreneurs and savvy customers, this is the place. Ideal for - Headhunters - Tech startups - Collaboration Saas- Development Firms  1x    GOLD ($2/attendee)     - Logo (large) At Meet Up page - Logo on Projector - Sponsorship on our page - 3 minute plug- Appearance on Email  2x  SILVER ($1/attendee) - Logo At Meet Up page - Logo on Projector - Sponsorship on our page - Appearance on Email - 2 Minute plug  3x BRONZE ($0.50/attendee)  - Logo At Meet Up Page- Logo on Projector - Sponsorship on our page- Blurp on email- 1 Minute Plug

events.name: UXSG + AGILESG + #PRODUCTBEER - OPEN SPACE
events.description: We are excited to have Google Singapore to host our second combined communities Open Space meetup with UXSG and Product #Beer. This would be a open space format with the theme of "Working in Multi-disciplinary teams". The three communities would invite their members and ensure a healthy ratio among each group. This would provide Google with opportunity to observe in the open space and perhaps participate. The meetup requires all attendees to suggest ONE (1) topic with regards to "Working in Multi-disciplinary teams" at the point of event registration. We reserve the right to cancel your registration if the suggested topic is not contextually relevant. Special thanks to Google Singapore team for making the venue sponsorship possible and for generously providing food and beverages for all attendees. Also special thanks to fellow community leaders - Raven (UXSG) and Michael Ong (Product Beer) for agreeing to collaborate and co-host this special event for everyone.
events.location: Google Singapore, Mapletree Business City II, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-01

events.name: Andres Almiray night - Java libraries and Testing best practices
events.description:
Dear all,  we are delighted to have yet another Java champion come to Singapore.  Andres Almiray is a Java/Groovy developer and a Java Champion with more than 17 years of experience in software design and development. He has been involved in web and desktop application development since the early days of Java. He is a true believer in open source and has participated on popular projects like Groovy, Griffon, and DbUnit, as well as starting his own projects (Json-lib, EZMorph, GraphicsBuilder, JideBuilder). He is a founding member of the Griffon framework and Hackergarten community event. 



Talk 1 - Java Libraries You Can’t Afford to Miss The Java language has passed its 20th anniversary, and with it comes an incredible range of tools libraries to choose from; sometimes there are actually too many choices for the same task. This presentation covers those libraries that have risen to the top, having proved themselves to be worthy of a place in every developer’s toolbox, for both production and testing code. It also discusses some fairly new libraries that are bound to make a big impact in the ecosystem.  

Talk 2 - Testing Java Code Effectively The Java ecosystem has myriads of libraries and projects that can be used to create the features our customers require, there's no shortage of options everywhere you look when it comes to writing production code. But what about testing code? If you ascribe to the Clean Code ideals then you know that testing code is as important as production code. Luckily there are a good number of libraries that can be used with popular testing frameworks. In this session we'll discover how to write better parameterized tests; take care of concurrency related events; spy/mock/stub out collaborators to ensure cleaner and isolated tests; fake out REST APIs to test out client code; fake out REST clients to test out server code, and more. Other announcements - YOW! Night and YOW! conferenceOur friends from YOW! will run a meetup with Charles O'Farrell on July 18th. You can register here.In case you haven't heard of it, YOW! is a super-popular conference in Australia and is finally coming to Singapore with great speakers such as Josh Long. You can find all the information about YOW! Singapore here. Thanks and have a great day ahead!Michael.
events.location: Singapore Power, 240 Tanjong Pagar, Keppel Towers 2, Level 08

events.name: GTT0727: UX - Design Thinking
events.description: Introduction: Organizations who have yet to realise the importance of good user experience (UX) may risk their competition surpassing them at great speed and enjoying the benefits of well-designed products. But why is it so important? What is the role of design in creating optimal user experience? What is the future of UX? These are the questions we will be discussing in our upcoming Grab Tech Thursday, UX - Design Thinking. Please RSVP here. We look forward to seeing you at the event! Agenda: • 19:00 - Registration Opens • 19:10 - Happy Hour Networking with Bites & Drinks • 19:20 - Welcome Remarks & Presenter Introduction • 19:30 - Speaker #1: Rudi Lim ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/rudilim/ ), UX Research Lead South East Asia at Grab on "Designing for 600 million" • 20:00 - Speaker #2: Julee Hyunju Lee ( https://www.linkedin.com/in/hjulee/ ), Founder & Design Principal at UXStudio on "Design that Scales"  • 20:30 - Audience Q&A Session • 21:00 - Closing Remarks & Lucky Draw • 21:10 - Further Networking with Bites & Drinks • 22:00 - Closing Introducing our Speakers:   Note: Please RSVP here first and tell us your dietary restrictions, if any, so that we can better prepare the food and drinks for optimal merry making. About Grab Tech Thursdays: Grab Tech Thursdays is a monthly series for peers in Asia's tech startup community to share knowledge and best practices as well as provide an informal space for networking. Originally conceived within Grab to focus on pushing the boundaries of technology and business to Drive Southeast Asia Forward, we are excited to now make available these sessions on the last Thursday of each month to the wider tech/startup community. Stay tuned and check back for our line-up of interesting speakers and content.
events.location: Grab, 138 Cecil Street, #01-01 Cecil Court, Singapore 069538
